Historical

Summary

Biography

2019: Was a GLIAC All-Academic Team selection ... played in 12 games and made four starts (3 at DH and 1 at 1B) ... hit .130 (3-for-23) with one RBI ... drew three walks and scored three runs ... finished with a .130 slugging percentage and a .286 on-base percentage ... made two errors in 17 chances to post an .882 fielding percentage ... drew a walk and scored a run at UMSL (3/1) ... went 2-for-5 with two walks and two runs scored at Lake Erie (4/2) ... posted an RBI single at Davenport (4/26) ... Game-by-Game Stats.

2018: Named to the GLIAC All-Academic Team ... appeared in 19 games and made seven starts, all at designated hitter ... hit .176 with two doubles and one triple ... drove in five runs and scored four runs ... slugged .294 with a .237 on-base percentage ... collected 10 at-bats as a pinch-hitter and went 3-for-10 and one as a pinch-runner ... garnered first collegiate hit vs. Slippery Rock, with a double and later came around to score ... went 1-for-4 with two RBI and a triple plus a run scored in a start against Pace (3/14) ... followed with a 2-for-4 game against Mansfield (3/16) where he drove in two runs ...drove in a run in start against Tiffin (4/13) ...Game-by-Game Stats.

2017: Redshirted.

High School: A 2016 graduate of Detroit Catholic Central High School ... played three years on varsity for head coach Dan Michaels ... played summer ball for the Jet Box Baseball Club and head coach Tom Dimambro.

Personal: Full name--Michael C. Toth ... born on September 3, 1997, in Detroit ... son of Steven and Patricia Toth ... has one brother, Steven ... father played baseball at Wayne State from 1983 to 1986 ... is majoring in Management ... named to the Athletic Director's Honor Roll (term GPA 3.5+) for Fall 2016, Fall 2017 and Winter 2018 ... named to the Coach's Honor Roll (term GPA 3.0-3.49) for Winter 2019.

No stats available for the current season.
